main event: Mrs. R, a housewife, reportedly sighted two flying saucers in Jackson, Mississippi, on February 26, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were observed for approximately four minutes at an estimated altitude of 1000 to 1500 feet., The estimated diameter of the saucers was three to four feet., The objects maintained equidistance and drifted in a westerly direction., Mrs. R mentioned that the objects gave off a vapor trail similar to that of jet aircraft., A meteorologist confirmed that the objects could not have been weather balloons, as they traveled in the opposite direction.
witness description: Mrs. R, a housewife with detailed recollection of the incident
